intro: Oenothera baurii, commonly known as the silverleaf evening primrose, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is characterized by its silvery-white, fuzzy leaves and showy yellow flowers that open in the evening. The plant belongs to the Onagraceae family and is known for its ability to thrive in arid and rocky soils. Oenothera baurii produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and has historical uses in traditional medicine.
